definition: to make unclean or impure: such as
to corrupt the purity or perfection of : debase
to violate the chastity or virginity of : deflower
to make physically unclean especially with something unpleasant or contaminating
examples: … I had never allowed anyone to smoke in the truck. Drunk as I was, I knew that I was betraying something by allowing him to defile the truck's interior.

definition: to violate the sanctity of : desecrate
examples: went to jail for costuming themselves in the American flag and thus defiling it

definition: a narrow passage (as between hills, rocks, or cliffs) : gorge entry 1
examples: … come to us from a narrow defile in the Pennine Alps between Switzerland and Italy, a place called the Great St. Bernard Pass.

definition: to march off in a line
examples: … breaks out into a brave and glorious description of the forces, as they defiled through the principal gate of the city …
